How To


Public SSH Key Submition

Used to submit user's Public Key to the server for SSH Security.
This is used if you want to use the Git CLI instead of the GUI.
If you know how to use the CLI, then you know how to generate an SSH Key


Create/List Repositories

Repositories should NOT have any white-space (Spaces).
White-Spaces will be automatically removed.
Creating a Repository is simple, just type the Repository Name and press Create.
Listing a Repository occurs automatically at site launch or at repository creation.
Manually Listing the Repository refreshes the list to the latest Available Repositories.


Obtaining Repository URLs

Simply click on the Repository from the List to obtain the URL for the Repository.


Using the Repository

Download the Git GUI from Git's official site Here.
Follow the installation process.
Open up the Git GUI that was installed and clone the repository, giving the Repository URL from the List.
You are required to know the Server's git Password, which you will use to modify the Repository.
You are now all set to using the Git Server.
